page.title: 07FARMING HIGH ERCALL
page.content: There are nine farms in the High Ercall area. Most of them grow a range of crops and some keep animals. The crops they grow are grain crops, such as wheat and barley, potatoes and sugar beet. The sugar beet goes to the sugar beet factory nearby. Several acres are used for growing grass for silage which is fed to the farm animals in winter. Most farms have some cows, sheep and a few pigs.Many large greenhouses are to be found at Roden. However in recent years greenhouses have been pulled down because of competition from Holland. Dutch tomatoes can be produced cheaper than English tomatoes. Many workers have lost their jobs. By Richard Davies and Stuart Breeze
